citation.article-title: Thermococcus alcaliphilus sp. nov., a new hyperthermophilic archaeum growing on polysulfide at alkaline pH.

p.s: Description of Thermococcus alcaliphilus sp. nov.
Thermococcus alcaliphilus (al.ca.li'phil.um. N.L.n. alcali (from Arabic al end, quaff soda ash); Gr.adj. philus loving; N.L. adj. alcaliphilus liking alkaline media)
Cells are coccoid-shaped, 0.8 to 1.3 μm in diameter.
Temperature range for growth from 56 to 90°C optimum around 85°C Range of growth from pH 6.5 to 10.5 with the optimum around pH 9.0; growth from 1 to 6% NaCl with an optimum around 2-3%.
Yeast extract, peptone, meat extract, tryptone, and casein are fermented.
Growth is not inhibited by H2.
Growth with and without polysulfide or sulfur with a significant stimulation of the growth rate in the presence of polysulfide or sulfur.
Fermentation products (on yeast extract with sulfur) are isovalerate, isobutyrate, propionate, acetate, CO2, NH3, and H2S.
In the absence of sulfur, H2 is formed.
G+C content of DNA is approximately 42 tool%.
Core lipids consist of tetraether and diphytanyl.
Isolated from a shallow marine hydrothermal system at Vulcano Island, Italy.
